content.meaning: Blue Belt represents the sky toward which the plant grows - the student is reaching for greater heights in knowledge and skill.
content.significance: Like a plant that has grown tall and strong, reaching toward the blue sky, the blue belt student has developed solid intermediate skills and is ready for advanced challenges.
content.symbolism: Aspiration, reaching higher, expanding horizons, intermediate mastery

questions.question: What does the blue belt represent?
questions.answer: The sky toward which the plant grows - the student is reaching for greater heights in knowledge and skill.

questions.question: What stage of development does the blue belt symbolize?
questions.answer: A student who has developed solid intermediate skills and is ready for advanced challenges.

content.meaning: Dan-Gun is named after the legendary founder of Korea in 2333 BC. He is said to be the grandson of the King of Heaven.
content.significance: This pattern honors Korean heritage and the mythical beginnings of the Korean nation, connecting students to the cultural roots of Taekwondo.
content.historical_importance: Dan-Gun represents the connection between Korean martial arts and Korean cultural identity, emphasizing the spiritual and cultural aspects of training.
content.new_challenges: Introduces more complex blocking techniques and coordination between multiple limbs.

questions.question: Who is Dan-Gun?
questions.answer: The legendary founder of Korea in 2333 BC, said to be the grandson of the King of Heaven.

questions.question: How many movements are in Dan-Gun?
What new blocking technique is introduced in Dan-Gun?
Why is Dan-Gun pattern culturally important?
questions.answer: It honors Korean heritage and connects students to the cultural roots of Taekwondo.

content.definition: Step sparring is a controlled practice method where students practice offensive and defensive techniques in a predetermined sequence.
purpose: Practice techniques in a realistic but safe environment
Learn proper attack and defense coordination

types.name: Three-step sparring
types.description: Attacker performs three attacks, defender blocks and counters

types.name: Two-step sparring
types.description: Attacker performs two attacks, defender blocks and counters

types.name: One-step sparring
types.description: Attacker performs one attack, defender blocks and counters

safety_principles: Stop immediately if someone is uncomfortable

questions.question: What is step sparring?
questions.answer: A controlled practice method where students practice offensive and defensive techniques in a predetermined sequence.

questions.question: What are the three types of step sparring?
What is the main purpose of step sparring?
questions.answer: Develop timing and distance judgment while practicing techniques safely.

techniques_required: Twin forearm block with power and coordination
Back fist strike with proper whipping motion
Front snap kick with good balance
content.expectations: Demonstrate intermediate level techniques with good power and timing, perform pattern with understanding, and safely execute basic step sparring

questions.question: What pattern is required for 5th keup grading?
What step sparring is introduced at 5th keup?
What new striking technique is emphasized at 5th keup?
questions.answer: Back fist strike and elbow strikes
